name: SongBase
short_description:
SongBase can be used to make music on your laptop or PC with up to 15 instrumental voices and a percussion track.  Instruments can be chosen from either the default soundbank of 128 instruments or other soundbanks of your choice.

Songs can be developed, tested and edited very quickly and easily by virtue of the database structure and the JFugue MusicString notation.  Notes within a MusicString are specified by their name and octave or by their MIDI value and their durations are specified either by character code, or numerically.  A scale of quarter notes can be written as:

C5q D5q E5q F5q G5q A5q B5q C6q

Within the application, use File/Template to create a song, then File/Tree View and expand the nodes.  Select each bar in turn and enter the notes using JFugue MusicString notation.  Select "Song" and press Play to play back your music and then, from the File menu, export to MIDI, MusicXML or WAV for music processing or publishing.

Java Runtime is required.
summary: Database application for making music using JFugue MusicStrings
